Class ClientAPI

  • java.lang.Object
    • ClientAPI
  • public class ClientAPI
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides the functions necessary for the client application to connect to and interact with the MasterServer. All methods will only be useful once a connection has been established, meaning connectToServer returned true. Methods for sending and receiving information will only be useful once addUser or authenticate have succeeded. Passwords passed to either of these methods are hashed before they are sent to the server.

      Class constructor.

      Closes the internal stream objects and TCP socket used to communicate with the server.

        Class constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • connectToServer

        public boolean connectToServer()
        Attempts to connect to the server.
        Returns:
        true if connection is successful, false otherwise

      • authenticate

        public boolean authenticate​(java.lang.String uname,
                            java.lang.String passwd)
        Sends a request to the server to authenticate this session with the provided credentials.
        Parameters:
        uname - the username associated with the account
        passwd - the password to the account
        Returns:
        true if authentication was successful, false otherwise

      • addUser

        public boolean addUser​(java.lang.String uname,
                       java.lang.String passwd)
        Sends a request to the server to add a user with the provided credentials. If successful, this user is also authenticated.
        Parameters:
        uname - the username for the user to add
        passwd - the password for the user to add
        Returns:
        true if a user was successfully added, false otherwise

      • getFileListFromServer

        public boolean getFileListFromServer()
        Sends a request to the server to update the internal list of this authenticated user's files.
        Returns:
        true if list was successfully updated, false otherwise

      • getFilesArray

        public java.lang.String[] getFilesArray()
        Creates an array of Strings representing each of this user's files. Each string contains the file name, file size, and date created of the file, delimited with double colons, "::". File size is rounded to B, MiB, or GiB depending on file size.
        Returns:
        the array of file information

      • deleteFile

        public boolean deleteFile​(java.lang.String fname)
        Sends a request to the server to delete the specified file belonging to this user.
        Parameters:
        fname - the name of the file to delete
        Returns:
        true if deletion was successful, false otherwise

      • downloadFile

        public boolean downloadFile​(java.lang.String fileToDownload,
                            javax.swing.JProgressBar jProgressBar)
        Sends a request to the server to download the specified file to this device. The file will go to the user's Downloads directory.
        Parameters:
        fileToDownload - the name of the file to download
        jProgressBar - a progress bar to update as the download progresses. This argument can be null.
        Returns:
        true if the download was successful, false otherwise

      • uploadFile

        public boolean uploadFile​(java.io.File fileToUpload,
                          javax.swing.JProgressBar jProgressBar)
        Sends a request to the server to upload the specified file.
        Parameters:
        fileToUpload - file object representing the file to be uploaded.
        jProgressBar - a progress bar to update as the upload progresses. This argument can be null.
        Returns:
        true if the upload was successful, false otherwise

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the internal stream objects and TCP socket used to communicate with the server.
